title: ESM
body:
Hello.
Currently, this package uses the deprecated `CommonJS` type. Please consider switching to ESM.
author: maxpain

comments.body: CJS is used for maximum compatibility with Express

title: feat: eslint, cspell, prettier
body:
add eslint, cspell, prettier

```
npm run test
```

also check linting, formatting and spelling

**This PR cause a massive changes due to follow linting, formatting and spelling best practice**
author: nigrosimone

comments.body: Sorry, I'm not interested in having these things in the project

Why not? eslint, cspell and prettier are must to have in large project with multiple contributors. ESLint enables developers to discover problems with their code without actually executing their code. Prettier enforces a consistent code style across your entire codebase.
I find linters and prettier to be distrupting my workflow and code style a lot. And spell checkers to have false positives often.
Ok, I undestand. I have also added extensions for VSCode that help and a "fix" command for autofix. Try It. It's not invasive and help a lot.

title: Question: middleware and routing
author: cesco69

comments.body: idk it looks as short as possible already to me

title: question about typescript and esm
body:
Hi, you have an interesting project. 
I would like to clarify if you plan to support and develop it in the feature, as well as switch to using typescript and esm.
author: ruscon

comments.body: I want this project to be in JS. But I'm fine if someone contributes .d.ts file or JSDoc comments. Also cjs is used on purpose for compatibility with older projects.

> I want this project to be in JS

Why?
